instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message:
I Have Macbook Pro Retina <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Power LED is there, but it is not turning on, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Present, from power rails <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_X239</SIGNAL> missing not sure if I suppose check at this point, if anyone guide me here 
Power supply using .020amp

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Liquid damage was near <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, replaced new chip, I have <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v at pin number 1

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: What voltages are you missing? Exact voltage on PPBUS?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: exact voltage at ppbus 12.61v , missing rail <SIGNAL>PPBUS_X239_REG</SIGNAL>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message:
I have no idea what that rail is. Lets start here:

Is <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> present and a steady 3.3 volts?
Is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present?
Is <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_GR3</SIGNAL> is 3.3v steady 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> i couldn't find this rail on board, but <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> is not present

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Ok is <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> straight zero or does it pulse at all? If it's zero, then <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> will likely be missing as well. Make sure you're using a known good 60 watt or higher Magsafe 2, but after that, check around the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to see if you have any corroded probe points or resistors. Also check pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion and see if <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is present. If it is missing, inspect the SMC area for signs of liquid damage.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> IS ZERO, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> AREA SEEMS OK AND HAS 3V AT PIN 8, ON <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> NO CORROSION AND DOES HAVE 3.43V. <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> IS PRESENT ASWELL, SMC AREA IS CLEANED 

ORIGINALLY HAD LIQUID DAMAGE NEAR <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, NEAR RESISTANCE <RESISTOR>R1804</RESISTOR> AND <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: What are the chances board is short to ground somewhere, or chip i installed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> is faulty or maybe i didn't solder properly , board is consuming .020amp

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No Power
threads.message: Possible that your <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> is bad worth trying another check all traces to it as well

threads.message: I changed new chip, it's same status

threads.message: Is it possible there is crap under the SMC?
